byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and JUDY DEMPSEY

abstract: French Pres Nicolas Sarkozy and German Chancellor Angela Merkel, acknowledging that Europe's banks still need billions of euros to cushion against possible default by Greece, announce package of reforms will be ready by November when Group of 20 nations will meet; announcement comes as France, Belgium and Luxembourg agree to nationalize part of Belgian bank Dexia.
snippet: Leaders of the two countries promised more coordination of economic policies, but declined to provide specifics on how the bank recapitalization would work, or how much money they would commit.
lead_paragraph: Leaders of the two countries promised more coordination of economic policies, but declined to provide specifics on how the bank recapitalization would work, or how much money they would commit.

headline.main: Germany and France Say Deal Near to Recapitalize Banks
headline.print_headline: Germany and France Say Deal on Banks Is Near
headline.seo: Germany and France Near Deal to Recapitalize Banks
